action.action-desc: Mr. Gosar (for himself, Mrs. Kirkpatrick, Mr. Franks of Arizona, Mr. Amodei, and Ms. Sinema) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act for purposes of making claims under such Act based on exposure to atmospheric nuclear testing, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Downwinders Compensation Act of 2015.

section.header: Inclusion under the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act
section.text: Section 4(b)(1) of the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (42 U.S.C. 2210 note; Public Law 101–426) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking that portion of; and
by striking that consists of townships 13 through 16 at ranges 63 through 71; and

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by inserting all acreage in any county all or part of which is located in before that part.

section.header: Denial of charitable deduction for contributions that have a prerequisite for purchasing tickets to a college sporting event

subsection.text: Section 170(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Contributions that have a prerequisite for purchasing tickets to a college sporting event
paragraph.text: No deduction shall be allowed under subsection (a) for any contribution that has a prerequisite for purchasing tickets to a college sporting event.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to contributions made after the date of the enactment of this Act in taxable years ending after the date of the enactment of this Act.
